meanings.definition: The quality of affording easy familiarity and sociability.
meanings.sent1: The comradery among the teammates was evident in their shared laughter and inside jokes.
meanings.sent2: The office had a warm atmosphere of comradery, making it a pleasant place to work.
meanings.sent3: The comradery at the family reunion made even the shyest relatives feel at ease.
meanings.sent4: The comradery in the classroom was like a safety net, ensuring everyone felt supported.
meanings.sent5: The comradery on the camping trip created lasting bonds among the group.

meanings.definition: The quality of being friendly and welcoming to others.
meanings.sent1: Her comradery towards new students helped them feel included in the school community.
meanings.sent2: The comradery of the neighborhood made newcomers feel like part of the family.
meanings.sent3: The comradery of the team captain was so genuine that it put everyone at ease.
meanings.sent4: The comradery of the group was like a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The comradery of the club members created a sense of belonging for everyone.

meanings.definition: A feeling of friendship and mutual trust among people who spend a lot of time together.
meanings.sent1: The comradery among the classmates grew stronger with each group project they completed.
meanings.sent2: The comradery of the hiking group was built on shared experiences and mutual respect.
meanings.sent3: The comradery among the coworkers made even the toughest days more bearable.
meanings.sent4: The comradery of the band members was like a symphony of friendship and trust.
meanings.sent5: The comradery of the sports team was the secret ingredient to their success on and off the field.
